Package org.world.agents.player.melee

Class HitBox

java.lang.Object
org.world.agents.player.melee.HitBox
public class HitBox
extends java.lang.Object
The HitBox class hold information about the position/orientation of the weapon during attacks as well as whether it is dealing damage in a specific animation frame. While enemies check for the distance/orientation relative to the player when checking for damage that is not entirely accurate, especially during longer attacks/attacks that cover a large area. This class allows for fine-tuning the exact location/time that the weapon is in during each frame of the attack by holding an array of 9 damage points per frame of attack and an array of booleans for the whole attack which mark the frames of the animation that should damage enemies. In case an enemy is close enough to the player to be reasonably hit, it then checks the hitbox parameters in order to compute whether it was hit or not. Only if it is touched by any of the damage points corresponding to the current attack animation/frame does it register the hit.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private int[] currentXes
    Actual horizontal coordinates used in hit detection.
    private int[] currentYs
    Actual vertical coordinates used in hit detection.
    private boolean[][] damageFrame
    Array that marks in which frames the weapon is actually doing damage
    private int[][][] hitBoxParameters
    3D array which holds the coordinates for each of the 9 damage points, for each frame damaging of each attack The order index is attack, x/y coordinates for each point (9 points x 2 = 18), frame Each attack animation is assumed to have a maximum of 9 frames
    private Weapon weapon

  • Field Details

    • hitBoxParameters

      private int[][][] hitBoxParameters
      3D array which holds the coordinates for each of the 9 damage points, for each frame damaging of each attack The order index is attack, x/y coordinates for each point (9 points x 2 = 18), frame Each attack animation is assumed to have a maximum of 9 frames

    • damageFrame

      private boolean[][] damageFrame
      Array that marks in which frames the weapon is actually doing damage

    • currentXes

      private int[] currentXes
      Actual horizontal coordinates used in hit detection. Computed based on weapon's position and the point coordinates for the current animation/frame

    • currentYs

      private int[] currentYs
      Actual vertical coordinates used in hit detection. Computed based on weapon's position and the point coordinates for the current animation/frame

    • weapon

      private Weapon weapon
